summary: Email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) regarding document discovery requests related to the Epstein and Maxwell cases. The SDNY seeks to locate documents from previous investigations, referencing the SDFL (Southern District of Florida) investigation, the NPA (Non-Prosecution Agreement), and OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility).

connections.description: MI (SDNY) contacts M (ODAG) to coordinate on document discovery requests related to the Epstein/Maxwell cases, following up on a previous conversation from the prior summer.

events.title: SDNY charges Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York has recently charged Ghislaine Maxwell, prompting renewed document discovery efforts.

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's death previously mooted document discovery conversations between SDNY and ODAG.

events.title: Document discovery coordination call scheduled
events.description: ODAG and SDNY schedule a call for July 23 or 24, 2020, to discuss locating documents related to the Epstein/Maxwell cases from various offices (ODAG, SDFL, NDGA, OPR).

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY)
Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG)
keyFacts: The SDNY is actively seeking documents related to the Epstein investigation and the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) in anticipation of issues arising from the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution.
The document references a significant document collection conducted by the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) in the previous year (2019).
Key offices involved in document custody include ODAG, SDFL, NDGA, and OPR, indicating a multi-district investigative history.
Epstein's death in 2019 had previously halted similar document discovery discussions, which are now being revived due to Maxwell's charges.
